text: Harry Lampert (November 3, 1916 - November 13, 2004) was an American cartoonist and bridge teacher and writer, widely known for creating the DC Comics character the Flash, alongside his partner and writer Gardner Fox. He was born in New York City, New York, United States on November 3, 1916, and died November 13, 2004 in Boca Raton, Florida, of complications from prostate cancer; he was survived by wife Adele Lampert, daughter Karen Akavan and two grandsons. title: Harry Lampert
